column4: There is some process that is beeping every 20 minutes or so. Is there something cunning I can run to see what it is?
- Try going to your vt1 ... er, ctrl-alt-1 I think it is, or maybe c-a-f1.
My fingers know the answer to that one, but I'm not in front of my linoox box.
and then?
- Look for anything particularly interesting, wait 20 mins to see if anything pops up with the beek.
- That's your console, if there are system errors they could show up there.
But, it's a shot in the dark ... I don't really know what'd be causing beeping, I probably would've just wiped the disk if that happened to me and I didn't know what it was.
drastic :)
Kind of like the first time I saw the goetse man ... had to reintsall to make sure he was properly gone.
presumably to beep it must be accessing /dev/something?
- Not necessarily ... sending ^G to a terminal can cause a beep, not sure if that requires a special access to /dev/something.
ah ok
- I assume this is a PC-speaker beep, not a soundcard beep?
yes.. pc speaker
I'd check for system errors first then. Oh, a-f7 to get back to your X11 terminal from the text console. ;]
no errors
- Nothing special in /var/log/kern.log ?
Now there's a wide-open question.
only an mrtg cron job
which runs every 5 minutes, and that has no reason or way to beep
timmy - Probably 'cuz there's a bug in the installer ... ? Random guess there. ;]
you mean /var/log/messages ?
- I meant kern.log, but check as many log files as you care to.
I don't have kern.log
